citation.article-title: Identification of Acetobacter strains isolated from Indonesian sources, and proposals of Acetobacter syzygii sp. nov., Acetobacter cibinongensis sp. nov., and Acetobacter orientalis sp. nov.
citation.source: The Journal of General and Applied Microbiology

p.s: Description of Acetobacter syzygii sp. nov.

Acetobacter syzygii (sy.zy'gi.i. L. gen. syzygii derived from N. L. neut. n. vsyzygium, referring to the name of the fruit of the Malay rose apple (Syzygium malaccense) from which the type strain was isolated)
Cells are Gram-negative rods measuring from 0.8 by 2.0–3.0 μm, and motile with peritrichous flagella.
Colonies are circular, convex, glistening, and non-pigmented.

Positive for catalase, oxidation of ethanol to acetic acid, oxidation of acetate and lactate to carbon dioxide and water, growth at 20 to 37°C, at pH 3.5 to 8.0, in the presence of 0.35% acetic acid (pH 3.5), in the presence of 5% D-glucose, and in the presence of 2 to 7% ethanol, production of D-gluconate from D-glucose, and acid production from D-glucose, ethanol, and n-propanol.
Weakly positive for growth at 42°C, at pHs 3.0 and 9.0, in the presence of 20% D-glucose, and in the presence of 10% ethanol.
Variable for acid production from L-arabinose, D-xylose, and D-mannose.

Negative for oxidase, gelatinase, reduction of nitrate, production of cellulose, water soluble-brown pigment, H2S, indole, ammonia from L-arginine, and γ-pyrones from both D-glucose and D-fructose, production of 2-keto-D-gluconate, 5-keto-D-gluconate and 2,5- diketo-D-gluconate from D-glucose, ketogenesis from glycerol, growth in the presence of 30% D-glucose and in the presence of 15% ethanol, and acid production from D-fructose, L-sorbose, D-arabinose, D-galactose, L-rhamnose, D-mannitol, D-sorbitol, glycerol, trehalose, sucrose, maltose, lactose, melibiose, raffinose, dulcitol, methanol, and starch.
DNA base composition ranges from 54.3 to 55.4 mol%.
Isolation sources are unknown flowers and fruits (Malay rose apple and starfruit) in Indonesia.
The type strain is 9H-2T (=NRIC 0483T=IFO 16604T=JCM 11197T), and was isolated from fruit of Malay rose apple (Syzygium malaccense), of which the G+C content is 55.3 mol%.
